00020 #include <stdio.h>
00021 #include <stdlib.h>

00028 int evaluate_stmt(sqlite3_stmt *pp_stmt,
00029                   struct Entry *p_entry)
00030 {
00031         int num_column;
00032         int count;
00033         char *col_name;
00034         char *col_value;
00035         int tmp_priority = 0;
00036         int tmp_country_code = 0;
00037         int tmp_area_code = 0;
00038         unsigned long long tmp_number = 0;
00039 
00040 
00041         num_column = sqlite3_column_count(pp_stmt);
00042         col_name = sqlite3_malloc(2 * num_column * sizeof(const char *) + 1);
00043 
00044         for ( count = 0; count < num_column; count++ ) {
00045                 col_name = (char *)sqlite3_column_name(pp_stmt, count);
00046                 col_value = (char *)sqlite3_column_text(pp_stmt, count);
00047                 if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_PRIORITY) ) {
00048                         tmp_priority = atoi(col_value);
00049                 } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_COUNTRYCODE) ) {
00050                         tmp_country_code = atoi(col_value);
00051                 } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_AREACODE) ) {
00052                         tmp_area_code = atoi(col_value);
00053                 } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_NUMBER) ) {
00054                         tmp_number = atoll(col_value);
00055                 }
00056         }
00057 
00058         if ( PRIO_ALL == tmp_priority ) {
00059                 if ( tmp_country_code == (p_entry->country_code)
00060                                 && tmp_area_code == (p_entry->area_code)
00061                                 && tmp_number == (p_entry->number) ) {
00062                         return 1;
00063                 }
00064         } else if ( tmp_priority <= (p_entry->priority) ) {
00065                 if ( tmp_country_code == (p_entry->country_code)
00066                                 && tmp_area_code == (p_entry->area_code)
00067                                 && tmp_number == (p_entry->number) ) {
00068                         return 1;
00069                 }
00070         }
00071 
00072         return 0;
00073 }
00074 
00075 int add_blacklist_entry(int country_code,
00076                         int area_code,
00077                         unsigned long long number,
00078                         char *name,
00079                         char *reason,
00080                         int priority)
00081 {
00082         if ( priority < PRIO_ALL
00083                         || 0 == country_code
00084                         || 0 == area_code
00085                         || 0 == number ) return -1;
00086 
00087         sqlite3 *db;
00088         char *errMsg = 0;
00089         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];
00090         int rc;
00091         char error[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00092 
00093         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00094 
00095         if ( rc ) {
00096                 sprintf(error, "Can't open database: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00097                 write_logentry(error, "phonefirewall", ERR_FLAG);
00098                 sqlite3_close(db);
00099                 return -1;
00100         }
00101 
00102         sprintf(stmt, "INSERT INTO blacklist (%s, %s, %s, %s, %s, %s) VALUES(%d, %d, %d, %lld, \"%s\", \"%s\")", TB_PRIORITY, TB_COUNTRYCODE, TB_AREACODE, TB_NUMBER, TB_NAME, TB_REASON, priority, country_code, area_code, number, name, reason);
00103 
00104         rc = sqlite3_exec(db, stmt, NULL, 0, &errMsg);
00105         if ( SQLITE_OK != rc ) {
00106                 sprintf(error, "SQL error: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00107                 write_logentry(error, "phonefirewall", ERR_FLAG);
00108                 sqlite3_close(db);
00109                 return -1;
00110         }
00111 
00112         sqlite3_close(db);
00113 
00114         return 0;
00115 }

00159 int rm_blacklist_entry (int country_code,
00160                         int area_code,
00161                         unsigned long long number)
00162 {
00163         if ( 0 == country_code
00164                         || 0 == area_code
00165                         || 0 == number ) return -1;
00166 
00167         sqlite3 *db;
00168         char *errMsg = 0;
00169         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];
00170         int rc;
00171         char error[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00172 
00173         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00174 
00175         if ( rc ) {
00176                 sprintf(error, "Can't open database: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00177                 write_logentry(error, "phonefirewall", ERR_FLAG);
00178                 sqlite3_close(db);
00179                 return -1;
00180         }
00181 
00182         sprintf(stmt, "DELETE FROM blacklist WHERE %s = %d AND %s = %d AND %s = %lld", TB_COUNTRYCODE, country_code, TB_AREACODE, area_code, TB_NUMBER, number);
00183 
00184         rc = sqlite3_exec(db, stmt, NULL, 0, &errMsg);
00185         if ( SQLITE_OK != rc ) {
00186                 sprintf(error, "SQL error: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00187                 write_logentry(error, "phonefirewall", ERR_FLAG);
00188                 sqlite3_close(db);
00189                 return -1;
00190         }
00191 
00192         sqlite3_close(db);
00193         return 0;
00194 }

00233 
00234 int check_blacklist_entry(int country_code,
00235                           int area_code,
00236                           unsigned long long number,
00237                           int priority)
00238 {
00239         sqlite3 *db;
00240         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];       // The SQL statement as text string.
00241         sqlite3_stmt *pp_stmt = 0;  // The prepared statement
00242         const char **p_tail = 0;    // The unused part of stmt
00243         int rc;
00244         char logmsg[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00245         int found_flag = 0;
00246 
00247         struct Entry *p_entry = &entry;
00248         p_entry->country_code = country_code;
00249         p_entry->area_code = area_code;
00250         p_entry->number = number;
00251         p_entry->priority = priority;
00252 
00253         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00254 
00255         if ( rc ) {
00256                 sprintf(logmsg, "Can't open database: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00257                 write_logentry(logmsg, "phonefirewall", ERR_FLAG);
00258                 sqlite3_close(db);
00259                 return -1;
00260         }
00261 
00262         sprintf(stmt, "SELECT %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, %4$s FROM blacklist ORDER BY %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, %4$s", TB_PRIORITY, TB_COUNTRYCODE, TB_AREACODE, TB_NUMBER);
00263 
00264         rc = sqlite3_prepare_v2(db, stmt, sizeof(stmt), &pp_stmt, p_tail);
00265 
00266         if ( rc != SQLITE_OK ) {
00267                 sprintf(logmsg, "SQL error: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00268                 write_logentry(logmsg, "phonefirewall", ERR_FLAG);
00269                 sqlite3_close(db);
00270                 return -1;
00271         }
00272 
00273         while ( rc != SQLITE_DONE ) {
00274                 rc = sqlite3_step(pp_stmt);
00275                 if ( SQLITE_ROW == rc ) {
00276                         found_flag = evaluate_stmt(pp_stmt, p_entry);
00277                         if ( found_flag == 1) {
00278                                 sprintf(logmsg, "Number \"+%d %d %llu\" blocked successfully.", country_code, area_code, number);
00279                                 write_logentry(logmsg, "phonefirewall", INFO_FLAG);
00280                                 break;
00281                         }
00282                 }
00283         }
00284 
00285 
00286         // Cleaning up
00287         sqlite3_finalize(pp_stmt);
00288         sqlite3_close(db);
00289 
00290         return found_flag;
00291 }
00292 
00293 int check_whitelist_entry(int country_code,
00294                           int area_code,
00295                           unsigned long long number,
00296                           int priority)
00297 {
00298         sqlite3 *db;
00299         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];       // The SQL statement as text string.
00300         sqlite3_stmt *pp_stmt = 0;  // The prepared statement
00301         const char **p_tail = 0;    // The unused part of stmt
00302         int rc;
00303         char logmsg[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00304         int found_flag = 0;
00305 
00306         struct Entry *p_entry = &entry;
00307         p_entry->country_code = country_code;
00308         p_entry->area_code = area_code;
00309         p_entry->number = number;
00310         p_entry->priority = priority;
00311 
00312         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00313 
00314         if ( rc ) {
00315                 sprintf(logmsg, "Can't open database: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00316                 write_logentry(logmsg, "phonefirewall", ERR_FLAG);
00317                 sqlite3_close(db);
00318                 return -1;
00319         }
00320 
00321         sprintf(stmt, "SELECT %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, %4$s FROM whitelist ORDER BY %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, %4$s", TB_PRIORITY, TB_COUNTRYCODE, TB_AREACODE, TB_NUMBER);
00322 
00323         rc = sqlite3_prepare_v2(db, stmt, sizeof(stmt), &pp_stmt, p_tail);
00324 
00325         if ( rc != SQLITE_OK ) {
00326                 sprintf(logmsg, "SQL error: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00327                 write_logentry(logmsg, "phonefirewall", ERR_FLAG);
00328                 sqlite3_close(db);
00329                 return -1;
00330         }
00331 
00332         while ( rc != SQLITE_DONE) {
00333                 rc = sqlite3_step(pp_stmt);
00334                 if ( SQLITE_ROW == rc ) {
00335                         found_flag = evaluate_stmt(pp_stmt, p_entry);
00336                         if ( found_flag == 1) {
00337                                 sprintf(logmsg, "Number \"+%d %d %llu\" accpeted successfully.", country_code, area_code, number);
00338                                 write_logentry(logmsg, "phonefirewall", INFO_FLAG);
00339                                 break;
00340                         }
00341                 }
00342         }
00343 
00344 
00345         // Cleaning up
00346         sqlite3_finalize(pp_stmt);
00347         sqlite3_close(db);
00348 
00349         return found_flag;
00350 }
